channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At least 12 Colorado mail ballots were stolen and filled out; 3 of them were counted

item.title: Pennsylvania’s Technology Glitch Thursday Warns Flawed Voter System Is Overdue For Replacement
item.description: In 2019, then-Auditor General Eugene DePasquale (now running for attorney general) wrote a scathing report on the SURE System.

item.title: Delaware launches in-person early voting
item.description: Delaware launched early in-person voting on Friday as the U.S. 2024 election gets into full swing.

item.title: 11 Dems join GOP lawmakers to threaten UN funding over 'ongoing hostility' to Israel
item.description: A bipartisan coalition of Republicans and Democrats is threatening the United Nations' funding if it moves to undercut Israel in its war against Hamas...

item.title: How America’s War On Marriage Threatens Democracy
item.description: Via the Sexual Revolution and decades of Supreme Court decisions, our government has sought to punish marriage, rather than elevate it.

item.title: No, Trump Is Not a Fascist
item.description: Applying the F-word to Trump must be emotionally satisfying for the Left, whether it makes sense on the merits or politically.

item.title: Trump’s Proposed Tax Cuts
item.description: Our economy is plagued with the unintended consequences of short-sighted policies.

item.title: Trump, Harris dead even in national poll, with just one in four saying country headed in right direction
item.description: Former President Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris are in a dead heat among likely voters as Election Day nears, according to a new poll.

item.title: Trump Can’t Derail Social Security, But Harris’ Filibuster Plans Can
item.description: Harris and her allies, not Trump, want to eliminate the biggest guardrail preventing partisan changes to Social Security.

item.title: House Oversight Committee Demands More Docs From NewsGuard In Probe Of Government Censorship
item.description: Republicans are demanding more documents from the web service NewsGuard in probe of the company's collusion with federal censors.

item.title: 'Ill-fated effort': McConnell was 'furious' at Rick Scott's 2022 leader bid, book says
item.description: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell was reportedly "furious" when Sen. Rick Scott challenged his re-election as leader in 2022.

item.title: The Week: Kamala Would Nullify Religious-Liberty Protections
item.description: Plus: Trump’s genius McDonald’s stunt.

item.title: ‘Thought Crime’ Is Now a Reality in the U.K.
item.description: Praying silently in front of an abortion facility can now put you at legal risk in the United Kingdom — and even stricter rules are on the way.

item.title: Bruce Springsteen’s Absolute Betrayal
item.description: Road Diary mixes demagoguery with dishonesty.

item.title: Vulnerable NY Republican blasts Dem challenger's progressive endorsement after moderate showing at debate
item.description: Rep. Brandon Williams, R-N.Y., campaign slammed his opponent John Mannion in the competitive House race of running on an "anti-cop, pro-Hamas" ballot.

item.title: To fight misinfo, news outlets are putting plans in place to combat false election night stories
item.description: As news outlets get ready for election night, they're not only focusing on what happens. They're keeping watch over what doesn't.
